title: NO POTTING UP METHOD FOR TOMATO SEEDLINGS  - One Cup Method for Huge Tomatoes

tasks.task: Starting tomatoes from seed indoors using solo cups without potting up.
subtasks: Drill holes in solo cups for drainage.
Prepare a tray to hold the solo cups, ensuring there's a rim to contain them.
Obtain seed starting mix and moisten it in advance.
Fill solo cups halfway with the moist seed starting mix, compacting it to eliminate air pockets.
Plant two to three tomato seeds on the surface of the mix, cover with a quarter-inch of mix, and add vermiculite.
Water the tray directly, maintaining two to three inches of water until absorbed, avoiding overwatering.
Use a grow light to provide adequate sunlight for seed germination.
Monitor seedling growth and thin to one plant per cup when two leaves appear.
After four weeks, reduce soil level to the rim, trim leaves below the rim, and replant with potting soil to promote root growth.
Water as needed and transition plants to a sunny area or greenhouse, preparing for outdoor planting.
Harden off plants for two weeks before transplanting into the garden.
